content.description: Crux at the third bolt with some hard sloping holds.
content.location: The last climb on the far right of the cliff

content.description:
Boulder start, sloper holds, fun lay-back pull around corner and open book at top.

A bit PG rated for pulling up to ledge, ground fall potential.
content.location: right of Camazonia, left of Black Belt.

climbs.name: Rio Vista
climbs.fa: Leland Windham, Eric Ellis,Steve Martin, Feb. 1998

content.description: Worth while route if you are at this wall. The book calls it 10b, more like 10a to me, tell me what you think.
content.location: left side of arete, Crescendo on right, Oh Coulee on left

climbs.name: The Red Drill Rules
climbs.fa: Dale Fleshman, Jim Bonner, Lucky Gibson, May, 2001

content.description: Burly Boulder problem move off the deck. Pretty easy if you are tall, really hard if you are short.
content.location: On the left side of the first wall from the upper wall trail, to the right of Crescendo, and left of One move blunder.

content.description: As with many of the routes in Riverview Park, pull a cruxy boulder move off the deck and climb lower angle rock to the anchors.
content.location: When descending from the upper cliff band, this will be the first wall you pass.  4th bolt line from the right.  Three routes to the right of Weep Holes on a Sill 5.11a.  Just right of Red Drill and obvious crack.

content.description: Tricky down low. But look around there are huge holds around the corner. A great warm up for climbs in the area and usually has a party on it
content.protection: 3 bolts chain anchors on top. a little run out from the 3rd bolt to the chains
content.location: On the left facing pillar midway through the cliff

content.description: Start to the right of a prominent arete and climb the face, trending up and left.  The moves are easiest to the right of the bolt line.  Cut left to the arete and romp to the finish.
content.location: Immediately left of The Creation of Tranquility, on the arete

content.description: Good climb with fun holds. A bit wandering at the top.
A fun, steep start on good holds gets you to an awesome finish on gas pockets up high.
Tricky crux that is hard to figure out onsight. Good holds are all around you but finding them first go can be hard.
content.protection: 5 bolts with chain anchors at the top
content.location: Route is at lookers left of the Cliff

content.description: A mixed protection climb on the right side of Riverview Park.  The climb starts clipping bolts to a ledge and then move into a finger/hand crack for about 10 feet to the chains.
content.protection: Four bolts and a 0.5 or 0.75 C4 or both for the crack.
content.location: Right side of Riverview Park, right of the Creation of Tranquility.  You will notice the crack at the top of the climb.

content.description: Another one move wonder, but fun anyhow.
content.location: start is at a off width slot, between One Move Blunder and Masticate.

content.description:
A really fun and interesting 10a.

Traverses to the right with layback. You can climb the face(10a) or arete (5.8) on the upper portion

Pretty challenging for the grade.
content.location: on the right end of a face that has Camazonia. On the right is a gully and then the 3 bolt Oh Coulee 5.8.
